title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A novel set in the Roaring Twenties, focusing on the mysterious Jay Gatsby.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A gripping, heart-wrenching, and wholly remarkable tale of coming-of-age in a South poisoned by virulent prejudice.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian social science fiction novel and cautionary tale, warning of the dangers of totalitarianism and authoritarianism.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A story about the experiences of a young man, Holden Caulfield, as he faces adolescence and his struggle with depression.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A romantic novel that charts the emotional development of the protagonist, Elizabeth Bennet, as she learns about the repercussions of hasty judgments.
